meanings.definition: Excessive belief in the power of scientific knowledge and techniques.
meanings.sent1: Her scientism led her to dismiss any ideas that were not backed by scientific evidence.
meanings.sent2: Some people fall into scientism, thinking science has all the answers.
meanings.sent3: John's scientism was so strong that he refused to believe in anything that couldn't be proven by science.
meanings.sent4: The scientism in the room was palpable, overshadowing any other form of reasoning.
meanings.sent5: The cult's scientism bordered on fanaticism, with blind faith in scientific solutions.

meanings.definition: The uncritical acceptance of scientific knowledge and methods as the only valid ones.
meanings.sent1: His scientism prevented him from considering alternative viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: Scientism can limit one's ability to think outside the scientific box.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the audience's scientism, saying they believed in science like it was a religion.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, scientism was a shield against any form of skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The politician's scientism was evident in his speeches, always relying on scientific data to make his points.
